name: Probabilistic Modelling in Genomics 2016
tagline: Evaluating assembly methods for the highly repetitive genome of the obligate intracellular bacterium Orientia tsutsugamushi
body:
## References
Cho, N.-H., Kim, H.-R., Lee, J.-H., Kim, S.-Y., Kim, J., Cha, S., Kim, S.-Y., Darby, A.C., Fuxelius, H.-H., Yin, J., et al. (2007). [The Orientia tsutsugamushi genome reveals massive proliferation of conjugative type IV secretion system and host-cell interaction genes.](http://www.pnas.org/content/104/19/7981.long) Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U. S. A. 104, 7981–7986.

Koren, S., Harhay, G.P., Smith, T.P., Bono, J.L., Harhay, D.M., McVey, S.D., Radune, D., Bergman, N.H., and Phillippy, A.M. (2013). [Reducing assembly complexity of microbial genomes with single-molecule sequencing.](https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/gb-2013-14-9-r101) Genome Biol. 14, R101.

## Tools
**Canu**

Koren S, Walenz BP, Berlin K, Miller JR, Phillippy AM. [Canu: scalable and accurate long-read assembly via adaptive k-mer weighting and repeat separation.](http://biorxiv.org/content/early/2016/08/24/071282) bioRxiv. (2016).

[Canu download](https://github.com/marbl/canu)

**HGAP2**

Chin, C.-S., Alexander, D.H., Marks, P., Klammer, A.A., Drake, J., Heiner, C., Clum, A., Copeland, A., Huddleston, J., Eichler, E.E., et al. (2013). [Nonhybrid, finished microbial genome assemblies from long-read SMRT sequencing data.](http://www.nature.com/nmeth/journal/v10/n6/abs/nmeth.2474.html)  Nat. Methods 10, 563–569.

[HGAP2 download](https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/HGAP-2.0)

**Celera Assembler**

[Celera download](http://wgs-assembler.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php?title=Main_Page)

**Spades**

Nurk, S., Bankevich, A., Antipov, D., Gurevich, A., Korobeynikov, A., Lapidus, A., Prjibelsky, A., Pyshkin, A., Sirotkin, A., Sirotkin, Y., et al. (2013). [Assembling Genomes and Mini-metagenomes from Highly Chimeric Reads.](http://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007%2F978-3-642-37195-0_13) (Springer Berlin Heidelberg), pp. 158–170.  

Antipov, D., Korobeynikov, A., McLean, J.S., and Pevzner, P.A. (2016). [hybridSPAdes: an algorithm for hybrid assembly of short and long reads.](http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/32/7/1009) Bioinformatics 32, 1009–1015.

[Spades download](http://bioinf.spbau.ru/spades)

**QUAST**

Gurevich, A., Saveliev, V., Vyahhi, N., and Tesler, G. (2013). [QUAST: quality assessment tool for genome assemblies.](http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/29/8/1072) Bioinformatics 29, 1072–1075.

[QUAST download](http://quast.sourceforge.net/)

**MLST**

[MLST typing](https://github.com/tseemann/mlst)

**Kraken**

Wood, D.E., Salzberg, S.L., Venter, C., Remington, K., Heidelberg, J., Halpern, A., Rusch, D., Eisen, J., Wu, D., Paulsen, I., et al. (2014). [Kraken: ultrafast metagenomic sequence classification using exact alignments.](https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/kraken/) Genome Biol. 15, R46.
[Kraken download](https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/kraken/)
 
**Pilon**

Walker, B.J., Abeel, T., Shea, T., Priest, M., Abouelliel, A., Sakthikumar, S., Cuomo, C.A., Zeng, Q., Wortman, J., Young, S.K., et al. (2014). [Pilon: An Integrated Tool for Comprehensive Microbial Variant Detection and Genome Assembly Improvement.](http://dx.doi.org/10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0112963) PLoS One 9, e112963.

[Pilon download](https://github.com/broadinstitute/pilon/wiki)

**Blobplots**

Kumar, S., Jones, M., Koutsovoulos, G., Clarke, M., and Blaxter, M. (2013). [Blobology: exploring raw genome data for contaminants, symbionts and parasites using taxon-annotated GC-coverage plots.](http://dx.doi.org/10.3389/fgene.2013.00237) Front. Genet. 4, 237.

[Blobtools download](https://drl.github.io/blobtools/)

**SSPACE**
Boetzer, M., Henkel, C. V, Jansen, H.J., Butler, D., and Pirovano, W. (2011). [Scaffolding pre-assembled contigs using SSPACE.](https://doi.org/10.1186/1471-2105-15-211) Bioinformatics 27, 578–579.

[SSPACE download](https://github.com/nsoranzo/sspace_basic)
